page.title: List of current Canadian first ministers

revisions.rev:
[[Canada]] is a country that occupies most of northern [[North America]], extending from the [[Atlantic Ocean]] in the east to the [[Pacific Ocean]] in the west and northward into the [[Arctic Ocean]]. A federation that comprises [[Provinces and territories of Canada|ten provinces and three territories]], Canada is a [[parliamentary democracy]], with a Prime Minister as its head of government; and a [[constitutional monarchy]], with [[Queen Elizabeth II]] as its head of state.{{cite web|accessdate=2008-11-20|url=https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/geos/ca.html|title=Canada |publisher=CIA World Factbook }} Each of the country's provinces and territories has a head of government, called the ''Premier'' to avoid confusion with the federal Prime Minister.{{cite web|accessdate=2008-11-20|url=http://www.collectionscanada.gc.ca/confederation/kids/h2-1800-e.html|title=Glossary|date=2001-05-10 |publisher=Library and Archives Canada }} All but four of the Premiers are men. The longest-serving Premier is [[Jean Charest]] of [[Quebec]], who has held the position since June 6, 2003; the newest Premier is [[Bob McLeod (politician)|Bob McLeod]] of the [[Northwest Territories]], who assumed office on October 26, 2011. There are thirteen incumbent Premiers, of which four are from a Liberal Party, three are from a Conservative Party, two are from the [[New Democratic Party]], one is from the [[Saskatchewan Party]], one is from the [[Yukon Party]], and two are [[Non-partisan democracy|non-partisan]].{{cite web|url=http://www.christyclark.ca/premier/ |title=British Columbia Premier Christy |publisher=British Columbia Liberals |date= |accessdate=2011-03-15}} ==Current Canadian first ministers== {{legend2|#def|[[Conservative Party of Canada]]|border=1px solid #aaa}} {{legend2|#ffe8e8|[[Liberal Party of Canada#Regional Liberal parties|Liberal Party]]|border=1px solid #aaa}} {{legend2|#ffe1c4|[[New Democratic Party]]|border=1px solid #aaa}} {{legend2|#dfd|[[Saskatchewan Party]]|border=1px solid #aaa}} {{legend2|#DEF|[[Progressive Conservative Party of Canada|Progressive Conservative Party]]|border=1px solid #aaa}} {{legend2|#CDE|[[Yukon Party]]|border=1px solid #aaa}} {{legend2|#fff|[[Consensus government]]|border=1px solid #aaa}} {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- style="background:#ccc;" !colspan="2"| First minister !
